english_translation: From Hamadan, and his kunya is Abu Abdullah, and he died in the year one hundred and sixty-seven in the caliphate of al-Mahdi, and he had rejected hadiths (munkar ahadith). Affan said: Muhammad ibn Talhah used to narrate from his father, and his father had died long ago, and the people were as if they disbelieved him. But who would dare to say to Muhammad ibn Talhah that you lie? He was among those of high status, and he was...

narrators.name: Unknown narrator reporting about Muhammad ibn Talhah
narrators.full_name: Likely an early biographical dictionary author

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Talhah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Talhah ibn Masraf al-Yami
reliabilityIssues: narrating from deceased father with doubtful transmissions

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Talhah is explicitly graded as having munkar (rejected) ahadith. Affan's statement indicates people suspected him of lying but were reluctant to accuse him due to his status.

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Talhah had munkar (rejected) ahadith according to the source
potential_issues.impact: This is a serious reliability issue. Hadiths with munkar ahadith are not acceptable in the hierarchy of hadith grading. His transmissions are considered rejected.

potential_issues.issue: Narrating from deceased father after long time interval
potential_issues.impact: He narrated from his father who had died long ago, which raises questions about chain reliability. The people apparently doubted his accuracy.
Affan's statement indicates widespread doubt about his reliability, though people refrained from directly accusing him due to his status.

potential_issues.issue: Biographical entry is fragmentary and incomplete
potential_issues.impact: The text ends mid-sentence ('and he was...'), indicating this is part of a larger biographical dictionary entry that has been truncated.

english_translation: Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah ibn Hudayj ibn al-Ruhail ibn Zuhayr ibn Khaithamah ibn Abi Hamran, and his name is al-Harith ibn Mu'awiyah ibn al-Harith ibn Malik ibn Awf ibn Sa'd ibn Hurayym ibn Ja'fa ibn Sa'd al-Asheera from Mudhaj, and Zuhayr's kunya is Abu Khaithamah.

english_translation: He moved to al-Jazira (Mesopotamia) and settled there until he died.

chainIssues: This is a fragmentary biographical statement, likely continuing from the previous entry about Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah. It provides only minimal biographical information about relocating to al-Jazira.

potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a sentence fragment from a larger biographical entry with minimal standalone information.

Topics: Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah's migration to al-Jazira region

english_translation: Narrated by Amr ibn Khalid al-Misri, who said: And I heard Said ibn Mansur praising him excellently, and commanding to write from him. He said: Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah came to al-Jazira in the year one hundred and sixty-four, or at the beginning of the year one hundred and seventy-three, during the caliphate of Harun. He was trustworthy, reliable, steadfast, trustworthy, and prolific in hadith.

chainIssues: Amr ibn Khalid al-Misri is Saduq, which is moderately reliable. He reports direct hearing from Said ibn Mansur regarding praise of Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah. The chain is reasonably reliable for biographical transmission.

potential_issues.issue: Amr ibn Khalid al-Misri is Saduq, not among the highest grades
potential_issues.impact: While Saduq is generally acceptable, this is lower than Thiqah. The content is biographical praise rather than hadith transmission.

Topics: Biographical assessment of Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah by Said ibn Mansur
Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah's arrival and settlement in al-Jazira region
Scholarly testimonies to Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah's reliability and prolific hadith transmission

english_translation: Mawla (client/freed slave) of Banu Tamim, and his origin was from Basra, and he was a tutor (educator) for the children of Dawud ibn Ali ibn Abdullah ibn Abbas, and he died in Baghdad in the year one hundred and sixty-four in the caliphate of al-Mahdi, and was buried in the cemetery of al-Khizran, and he was trustworthy, prolific in hadith.

english_translation: From the descendants of al-Harith ibn Qays who became Muslim, and he had nine wives, so the Prophet ﷺ commanded him to keep from them four, and to separate from the rest. And Qays's kunya is Abu Muhammad. He said: And it was said to Qays: al-Hawwal, due to the abundance of his hearing and knowledge. And Qays died in Kufa in the year one hundred and sixty-eight at the end of the caliphate of al-Mahdi.

narrators.name: Qays ibn al-Rabi'
